moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 d6: Philidor Defence: My 2nd philidor in this ongoing tournment
moves.3... Bg4: this B development is premature - is amply demonstrated in one of the Morphys Game but players still persist ...
moves.4. dxe5 Bxf3: Forced, If 4....,dxe5; then 5.Qxd8 & 6.Nxe5 _ white is a healthy p up.
moves.5. Qxf3 dxe5 6. Bc4: Develops & aims at blacks weak spot -f7p.
moves.6... Nf6: develops & blocks the f7#; but white shifts his Q to b-file
moves.7. Qb3: sets a battery & reinstates the threat on f7-p & has another threat on b7-p
moves.8. Nc3: Text is better than 8.Qxb7 as it is met with 8...,Qb4  when white is forced to Q swap. Text blocks the check, defends the e4-p & white is now ready for Qxb7
moves.8... b6: Black deviates. In the historical game Morphys opponent chose ....,c6 to defend his b7-p & here ...,
moves.9. Bg5: The famous pin ..., threat is Nd5
moves.9... h6: It seems blacks has underetimated the threat or overlooked
moves.10. Nd5: Ignors blacks attack & counters with my big one
moves.10... Qd8: This leaves his f7-p hanging & white goes for the kill. Better for black was 10....,Qd7, though here also white wins but not as fast as in the game, as after 11.Bxf6 - wins a piece  & black cant take piece due to 12.Nxf6  - forks both Q & K
moves.11. Nxf6+: This exchange clears the attacking diagonal
